ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: he said, 'You are people we do not know.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He said: "You are people I do not know."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: he said: "Surely you are an unknown folk."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: he said, "You seem to be strangers".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He said, “You are an unfamiliar people.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He (Lut) said: "Verily, you are people unknown to me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: Surely you are an unknown people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: he said, 'Surely you are a people unknown to me!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: Lo! ye are folk unknown (to me).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: verily ye are a people stranger.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: he said, ‘You are indeed strangers [to me].’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He said: "Ye appear to be uncommon folk."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He said: "Verily! You are people unknown to me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: he said to them: 'I do not know you'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “You are a people unknown to me.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He said, "Indeed, you are people unknown."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:62] he said, to them, ‘Indeed you are strangers’, that is, I do not know you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said: Lo! ye are folk unknown (to me)) you are unknown in our country, nor are we familiar with the wording of your greeting.
